channel.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
channel.description:
^^
looking for an efficient non-messy way to do this, any ideas?
EDIT: refers to stairs, ladders, anything of that sort.

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
item.dc:creator: @Christmas_tree Christmas_tree
item.description:
@Christmas_tree wrote:

Anybody who suggests Switch statement, rethink yourself.

Well you could program individually, or you could do some server-sided cache loading, check the object, check the distance, and check the mapdata to see where objects are being spawned.

Just a suggestion.

Read full topic

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?

item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I want to refer back to this. The “Y+6400” isn’t always accurate, there are certain staircases that do not use that method. And

EDIT: What about going down a staircase? Like underground? Y-6400? I doubt it

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I suppose you could make it location based

public class ObjectEntity {
	private final int id;
	private final Location location;

	public ObjectEntity(final int id, final Location location) {
		this.id = id;
		this.location = location;
	}

	@Override
	public int hashCode() {
		final int prime = 31;
		int result = 1;
		result = prime * result + id;
		result = prime * result
			+ ((location == null) ? 0 : location.hashCode());
		return result;
	}

	@Override
	public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
		if (this == obj) {
			return true;
		}
		if (obj == null) {
			return false;
		}
		if (getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
			return false;
		}
		final ObjectEntity other = (ObjectEntity) obj;
		if (id != other.id) {
			return false;
		}
		if (location == null) {
			if (other.location != null) {
				return false;
			}
		} else if (!location.equals(other.location)) {
			return false;
		}
		return true;
	}
}
final HashMap<ObjectEntity, Location> stairs = new HashMap<ObjectEntity, Location>();
// ...
stairs.put(new ObjectEntity(stairId, someLocation), destination);
// when handling object packets
player.teleportTo(stairs.get(targetObject));

Read full topic

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:10, topic:464729”]The best method in my opinion is to have a default system where it just changes your height if there’s not a special case for the stairs implemented (no pun intended).[/quote]but a lot of the times jagex just makes the “upstairs” the same level floor just different coordinates

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

sinisoul:

irrc its like +4500 y or something like that.

i thought it was 6400 but idk, haven’t messed with rsps in a while

edit:

stairs move you up/down 1 or more height level(s) while ladders increase your Y coordinate by 6400.

item.title: Proper way to program a stair system?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:5, topic:464729”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=568837.msg4128680#msg4128680 date=1350787581]
Wouldn’t it be the same as ladders?
[/quote]

No, most ladders move the player to a different location. Where as the way he handled the stairs all that happens is the players height level is changed.[/quote]
Shouldn’t there be a parameter on where the ladder moves the player though? It could just be +1 height level of the players current location?

Read full topic
